source_sentence: 佛說舍衛國王十夢經
translation: Sutra on the Ten Dreams of King Śrāvastī

source_sentence: 附西晉錄
translation: Appendix to the Record of the Western Regions

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在舍衛國精舍，時有國王名波斯匿，夜夢十事：一者、三釜羅，
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, while the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī’s monastery in Sāvatthī, a king named Prasenajit had ten nightmares:

source_sentence: 兩邊釜沸氣交往來，不入中央空釜中。
translation: The boiling air coming from the two sides of the cauldron doesn't enter the empty cauldron in the center.

source_sentence: 二者、王夢見馬口亦食，尻亦食。
translation: 2. The king dreams that he sees a horse with his mouth eating as well and his buttocks eating as well.

source_sentence: 三者、見大樹生花。
translation: 3. He sees a large tree producing flowers.

source_sentence: 四者、見小樹生菓。
translation: Fourth, they see small trees producing fruit.

source_sentence: 五者、見一人切繩，人後有羊，羊主食繩。
translation: 5. He sees a man cutting a rope with a sheep behind him, and the owner of the sheep eats the rope.

source_sentence: 六者、見胡虜坐金銀床上以食金銀器。
translation: 6. He sees a Hu prisoner sitting on a gold or silver bed and eating from a gold or silver container.

source_sentence: 七者、見大牛母還從犢子[口*數]乳。
translation: 7. Seeing the mother of a large cow, he returns from the Vātsīputrīya [mouth*number] milk.

source_sentence: 八者、見群牛從四面鳴走來相趍欲鬪，當合未合不知牛處。
translation: Eighth, when he sees a group of cows coming from the four sides with cries and walkers who are lusting to fight each other, he doesn't know where the cow is if it's united or not.

source_sentence: 九者、見大陂池水，中央濁四邊清。
translation: Nine, he sees the water of a large pond that's turbid in the center and clear in the four sides.

source_sentence: 十者、見谿水正赤。
translation: Tenth, he sees that the water in the river is exactly red.

source_sentence: 王夢即覺，恐怖畏亡國及身。
translation: When the king woke up in a dream, he was terrified and feared losing his kingdom and body.

source_sentence: 明日即召左右群臣及諸異道人：「我昨夜夢見十事，誰能解之？」
translation: The next day, he summoned his left and right ministers and other heretics, Yesterday night, I dreamt of ten things; who will be able to understand them?

source_sentence: 有異道人言：「吾能解之，恐王聞之即不樂耳。」
translation: Some heretics said, I can understand it; I'm afraid the king won't be happy to hear it.

source_sentence: 王言：「便說，如卿所知。」
translation: The king said, Tell me as you know.

source_sentence: 異道人言：「王當亡國及身。」
translation: The heretic said, The king will lose his kingdom and body.

source_sentence: 王大驚怖不厭不，異道人言：「可厭，當殺太子及所重夫人，及其庫藏皆燒用祠天，
translation: The king was greatly frightened, but he did not tire of it. The heretics said, “You should be disgusted! You should kill the prince and his esteemed wife as well as their storehouses and burn them all for the sake of the

source_sentence: 王能爾者可得無他。」
translation: If the king can do so, he'll attain nothing else.

source_sentence: 王聞道人語，愁怪驚愕憂亦不樂，却入齋室思惟是事。
translation: The king heard the words of the Daoist monk and was greatly distressed, frightened, and unhappy. So he went into the fasting hall to think about this matter.

source_sentence: 王有夫人名曰摩利，就到齋室中問：「王何以晝入齋室，顏色不和憂乃爾，
translation: The king had a wife named Māra. He came to the chamber and asked, “How did you enter the chamber for the duration of the day?

source_sentence: 誰有過於王？」
translation: Who is superior to the king?

source_sentence: 王對曰：「汝莫問是事，但汝怖怯耳，非汝所知。」
translation: The king said, Don't ask about this matter; it's just that you're frightened and don't know it.

source_sentence: 夫人說言：「我是王之體，給緩當相告言。」
translation: The lady said, I'm the king's body, and I'll tell you to give it to me.

source_sentence: 王便為夫人說言：「我昨夜夢見十事，吾問道人解夢如是，甚惶怖，不知何告？」
translation: The king then said to his wife, I saw ten things in a dream last night, and I asked the monk how he understood the dream.

source_sentence: 夫人言：「莫愁憂也，譬如有人買金，磨著石上好惡自見，今佛近在精舍，
translation: The queen said, “Do not grieve. Consider the analogy of a man who buys gold and polishes it on a rock to see for himself what he likes and dislikes.

source_sentence: 可往問佛，災怪悉可知矣。」
translation: You can go there to ask the Buddha, and you'll be able to know all the disasters and monsters.

source_sentence: 王明日即召左右賢臣數千餘人，來詣佛所稽首佛足，王言：「我昨夜所夢十事，
translation: The next day the king summoned several thousand men of virtue from his right and left who had accompanied him to the Buddha’s place, bowed their heads at his feet, and said: Tonight I dreamt of ten things.

source_sentence: 願佛為我解說之。」
translation: May the Buddha explain it for me.

source_sentence: 佛告王言：「慎莫愁憂也！
translation: The Buddha told the king, Be careful not to grieve!

source_sentence: 王所夢者乃是後世變現耳。」
translation: The king's dream is about the transformations that will occur in a later life.

source_sentence: 佛言：「王夢見三釜羅，兩邊釜沸氣交往來，不入中央空釜中者，後世人不復供給貧窮親里及諸孤獨，
translation: The Buddha said, In a dream, the king saw three cauldrons, boiling and coming together in two side-by-side cauldrons, and he didn't enter the empty cauldron in the center, so later generations wouldn't provide for the

source_sentence: 兩富自相饋遺，王夢見是一事者，正為是耳。
translation: The two wealthy men gave their gifts to each other, and the king dreamt that they saw one thing, which was precisely this.

source_sentence: 王夢見馬口亦食，尻亦食者，後世大臣長吏，廩食於官復食於民，曲直者亦食，
translation: The king had a dream in which he saw that the horse's mouth also ate, and his buttocks also ate. In later generations, ministers and senior officials would eat from the officials and again from the people, and those who were twisted

source_sentence: 王夢見二事者，正為是耳。
translation: The king saw these two things in a dream, which is precisely what he did.

source_sentence: 王夢見大樹生花者，後世人年未滿三十，頭當生白髮，王夢見三事者，
translation: The king had a dream in which he saw flowers growing from a large tree. In later ages people under the age of thirty years old will grow white hair on their heads, and the king dreamt three things:

source_sentence: 正為是耳。
translation: That's precisely what it is.

source_sentence: 王夢見小樹生菓者，後世女人年未滿十五當行嫁抱兒，不知慚耻，王夢見四事者，
translation: The king dreamt that he saw a fruit growing from a small tree. In a later life, when the woman was under fifteen years old, she would marry and take her child in marriage without knowing shame.

source_sentence: 正為是耳。
translation: That's precisely what it is.

source_sentence: 王夢見一人切繩，人後有羊，羊主食繩者，後世女人，夫當從役若行賈販，
translation: The king had a dream in which he saw a man cutting the ropes and there was a sheep behind him. The owner of the sheep ate the ropes, but women from later generations would go on to serve as servants or act as merchants

source_sentence: 婦在其後將男子與共同房，食噉夫財，王夢見五事者，正為是耳。
translation: Behind her, the woman gave her husband a shared dwelling to live in, eating his wealth. The king dreamt that he saw five things, and this was precisely what happened.

source_sentence: 王夢胡虜好金銀床上以食金銀器者，後世人貴者當賤，賤者當貴，在上坐食食飲重味，
translation: The king dreamt that the Hu soldiers were seated on a good gold and silver couch to eat from golden and silver vessels. People of later ages who were noble people would be inferior, those who were humble people would be valuable, and those who were

source_sentence: 君子食糟糠，小人食粳糧，王夢見六事者，正為是耳。
translation: A gentleman eats grated rice and a small person eats millet, and the king dreams of seeing six things, which is precisely what he does.

source_sentence: 王夢見大牛還從犢子[口*數]乳者，後世人母當為女作媒，將他男子與女同房，
translation: The king had a dream in which he saw the great ox returning from Vātsīputrīya's [mouth*number] milk. In later generations, the mother of human beings would act as a match for the daughter and give her to another man

source_sentence: 母守門戶，撿取財物以自濟活，王夢見七事者，正為是耳。
translation: The queen’s mother guarded the door and collected all her belongings in order to keep herself alive. The king dreamt that he saw seven things, but this was precisely what happened.

source_sentence: 王夢見群牛從四面鳴走來相趣欲鬪，當合未合不知牛處者，後世貪淫多畜數婦，
translation: The king dreamt that he saw a herd of cows coming from the four sides, singing and coming in all directions to fight each other. When they came together or when they were not, he did not know where the cow was. In later ages

source_sentence: 王及臣民長者皆大歡喜，當來今世當爾不爾，須臾之間雲便解散，爾時顧見其怪，
translation: The king and his ministers and elders were all greatly delighted. In a moment the cloud dissolved, and then they looked at each other in wonder.

source_sentence: 欲令人畏天地之禁，解不復貪淫，守妻慈心除之妻害，王夢見八事者，
translation: Desiring to cause people to fear the heavenly and earthly prohibitions, they are freed from lust and sexual misconduct, observe their wives with kindness, and remove their harmfulness. The king dreams of eight things:

source_sentence: 正為是耳。
translation: That's precisely what it is.

source_sentence: 王夢見大陂池水，中央濁四邊清者，後世人在國中不敬長老，當敬邊國少年，
translation: The king had a dream in which he saw that the water of the great pond was so muddy at the center and the four sides were so clear at the four sides. Later generations did not venerate the elder but revered the youths of the border

source_sentence: 王夢見九事者，正為是耳。
translation: That's exactly what the king dreamt of seeing nine things.

source_sentence: 王夢見大谿峪水正赤者，後世人大臣長吏，所欲不知止足，興兵聚眾更相攻伐，
translation: The king had a dream in which he saw that the water of the great Anavatapta river was exactly red, and all the ministers and officials of later generations did not know what they wished to stop. They gathered an army and attacked each other

source_sentence: 當殺人民流血正赤，王夢見十事者，正為是耳。
translation: That's exactly what the king dreamt of seeing ten things, which is why he killed the people and bled so much blood.

source_sentence: 王莫恐莫恐！
translation: Don't be afraid, king! don't be afraid!

source_sentence: 於國於身妻子皆無他，是夢者皆為後世方來之事。」
translation: In the country, there's nothing else in his body or wife, and these dreamers are all things that come from a later life.

source_sentence: 王即長跪言：「得佛教，心即懽喜，如人持小器受膏，膏多器小更求大器，
translation: The king knelt down and said, “I have received the Buddha’s teaching. My heart is filled with joy. It is as if a man were to take a small vessel and receive some ointment; or if he were to ask for a large vessel of

source_sentence: 得大器更受之，即安隱不恐。」
translation: They'll attain the great container and accept it again, so they'll be comfortable and not afraid.

source_sentence: 王即稽首再拜，前以頭面著佛足而去。
translation: The king bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet and departed.

source_sentence: 還歸於宮，重賜正夫人，皆奪諸公大臣俸祿，不復信諸婆羅門語。
translation: Returning to the palace, they were given back to their proper wives and officials, who all lost their salaries and didn't believe in the words of the Brāhmaṇas.

source_sentence: 佛說舍衛國王十夢經
translation: Sutra on the Ten Dreams of King Śrāvastī
